types.name: Query
types.description: The root query type which gives access points into the data universe.

fields.name: node
fields.description: Fetches an object given its globally unique `ID`.

fields.name: allUsers
fields.description: Reads and enables paginatation through a set of `User`.

args.name: orderBy
args.description: The method to use when ordering `User`.

args.name: before
args.description: Read all values in the set before (above) this cursor.

args.name: after
args.description: Read all values in the set after (below) this cursor.

args.name: first
args.description: Only read the first `n` values of the set.

args.name: last
args.description: Only read the last `n` values of the set.

args.name: offset
args.description: Skip the first `n` values from our `after` cursor, an alternative to cursor based pagination. May not be used with `last`.

args.name: condition
args.description: A condition to be used in determining which values should be returned by the collection.

fields.name: user
fields.description: Reads a single `User` using its globally unique `ID`.

args.name: id
args.description: The globally unique `ID` to be used in selecting a single `User`.

fields.name: query
fields.description: Exposes the root query type nested one level down. This is helpful for Relay 1 which can only query top level fields if they are in a particular form.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The root query type must be a `Node` to work well with Relay 1 mutations. This just resolves to `query`.

types.name: Node
types.description: An object with a globally unique `ID`.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique identifier. Can be used in various places throughout the system to identify this single value.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: UsersOrderBy
types.description: Methods to use when ordering `User`.

types.name: Cursor
types.description: A location in a connection that can be used for resuming pagination.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: UserCondition
types.description: A condition to be used against `User` object types. All fields are tested for equality and combined with a logical ‘and.’

inputFields.name: _id
inputFields.description: Checks for equality with the object’s `_id` field.

inputFields.name: firstName
inputFields.description: Checks for equality with the object’s `firstName` field.

inputFields.name: lastName
inputFields.description: Checks for equality with the object’s `lastName` field.

inputFields.name: role
inputFields.description: Checks for equality with the object’s `role` field.

inputFields.name: password
inputFields.description: Checks for equality with the object’s `password` field.

inputFields.name: email
inputFields.description: Checks for equality with the object’s `email` field.

inputFields.name: age
inputFields.description: Checks for equality with the object’s `age` field.

inputFields.name: active
inputFields.description: Checks for equality with the object’s `active` field.

inputFields.name: verified
inputFields.description: Checks for equality with the object’s `verified` field.

inputFields.name: createdAt
inputFields.description: Checks for equality with the object’s `createdAt` field.

inputFields.name: updatedAt
inputFields.description: Checks for equality with the object’s `updatedAt` field.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: Datetime
types.description: A point in time as described by the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) standard. May or may not include a timezone.

types.name: UsersConnection
types.description: A connection to a list of `User` values.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description: The count of *all* `User` you could get from the connection.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges which contains the `User` and cursor to aid in pagination.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: A list of `User` objects.

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Information about pagination in a connection.

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: When paginating forwards, are there more items?

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: When paginating backwards, are there more items?

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: When paginating backwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: When paginating forwards, the cursor to continue.

types.name: UsersEdge
types.description: A `User` edge in the connection.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The `User` at the end of the edge.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique identifier. Can be used in various places throughout the system to identify this single value.

types.name: Mutation
types.description: The root mutation type which contains root level fields which mutate data.

fields.name: createUser
fields.description: Creates a single `User`.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: updateUser
fields.description: Updates a single `User` using its globally unique id and a patch.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: updateUserById
fields.description: Updates a single `User` using a unique key and a patch.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: deleteUser
fields.description: Deletes a single `User` using its globally unique id.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: deleteUserById
fields.description: Deletes a single `User` using a unique key.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

types.name: CreateUserInput
types.description: All input for the `createUser` mutation.

inputFields.name: clientMutationId
inputFields.description: An arbitrary string value with no semantic meaning. Will be included in the payload verbatim. May be used to track mutations by the client.

inputFields.name: user
inputFields.description: The `User` to be created by this mutation.

types.name: CreateUserPayload
types.description: The output of our `createUser` mutation.

fields.name: clientMutationId
fields.description: The exact same `clientMutationId` that was provided in the mutation input, unchanged and unused. May be used by a client to track mutations.

fields.name: user
fields.description: The `User` that was created by this mutation.

fields.name: userEdge
fields.description: An edge for our `User`. May be used by Relay 1.

args.name: orderBy
args.description: The method to use when ordering `User`.

fields.name: query
fields.description: Our root query field type. Allows us to run any query from our mutation payload.

types.name: UpdateUserInput
types.description: All input for the `updateUser` mutation.

inputFields.name: clientMutationId
inputFields.description: An arbitrary string value with no semantic meaning. Will be included in the payload verbatim. May be used to track mutations by the client.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The globally unique `ID` which will identify a single `User` to be updated.

inputFields.name: userPatch
inputFields.description: An object where the defined keys will be set on the `User` identified by our globally unique `ID`.

types.name: UserPatch
types.description: Represents an update to a `User`. Fields that are set will be updated.

types.name: UpdateUserPayload
types.description: The output of our `updateUser` mutation.

fields.name: clientMutationId
fields.description: The exact same `clientMutationId` that was provided in the mutation input, unchanged and unused. May be used by a client to track mutations.

fields.name: query
fields.description: Our root query field type. Allows us to run any query from our mutation payload.

types.name: UpdateUserByIdInput
types.description: All input for the `updateUserById` mutation.

inputFields.name: clientMutationId
inputFields.description: An arbitrary string value with no semantic meaning. Will be included in the payload verbatim. May be used to track mutations by the client.

inputFields.name: userPatch
inputFields.description: An object where the defined keys will be set on the `User` identified by our unique key.

types.name: DeleteUserInput
types.description: All input for the `deleteUser` mutation.

inputFields.name: clientMutationId
inputFields.description: An arbitrary string value with no semantic meaning. Will be included in the payload verbatim. May be used to track mutations by the client.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The globally unique `ID` which will identify a single `User` to be deleted.

types.name: DeleteUserPayload
types.description: The output of our `deleteUser` mutation.

fields.name: clientMutationId
fields.description: The exact same `clientMutationId` that was provided in the mutation input, unchanged and unused. May be used by a client to track mutations.

fields.name: query
fields.description: Our root query field type. Allows us to run any query from our mutation payload.

types.name: DeleteUserByIdInput
types.description: All input for the `deleteUserById` mutation.

inputFields.name: clientMutationId
inputFields.description: An arbitrary string value with no semantic meaning. Will be included in the payload verbatim. May be used to track mutations by the client.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
